thread.title: Dimitri Payet given hero's welcome home in Marseille's extra-time Coupe de France victory over Lyon
thread.title_full: Dimitri Payet given hero's welcome home in Marseille's extra-time Coupe de France victory over Lyon

author: Mick Gadd
title: Dimitri Payet given hero's welcome home in Marseille's extra-time Coupe de France victory over Lyon
text:
Payet enjoys a rousing reception on his return home (Photo: Getty) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Dimitri Payet began life back at Marseille with a hero's welcome as he came off the bench in extra-time at the Stade Velodrome. 
Marseille edged through 2-1 against Lyon in their Coupe de France tie and fans made it clear what they thought of the 29-year-old playmaker's arrival. 
The France international wrapped up a dramatic Â£25million move back to his old club on Sunday after letting Slaven Bilic know in no uncertain terms that he didn't want to stay in East London. Payet came on as an extra-time substitute in the Coupe de France (Photo: Getty) Dimitri Payet runs for the ball during the French Cup match against Lyon (Photo: Getty) Read More The biggest January transfers in and out of Europe's top five leagues 
Payet, who had refused to play for the Premier League club as he looked to force through a transfer, heard his name chanted by the home support before kick-off. 
Marseille took the lead after 25 minutes when Rod Fanni headed in a free-kick from Maxime Lopez, but they saw defender Patrice Evra, another January signing, limp off with a hamstring problem early in the second half. Read More Slaven Bilic refuses to blast "brilliant" Dimitri Payet as he reveals interest in signing Demba Ba 
Lyon, who are fourth in Ligue 1, equalised after 64 minutes when midfielder Corentin Tolisso knocked the ball in at the far post. 
Marseille coach Rudi Garcia sent Payet on to replace Florian Thauvin in the fourth minute of the first extra period of the cup clash. After a minimal impact on the victory, Payet was given given a standing ovation at full-time (Photo: Getty) After refusing to play at West Ham the French international appears delighted to be home (Photo: Getty) 
The France international received a standing ovation from the home supporters as he took up a position on the left. 
Marseille found their winner after 109 minutes after Remy Cabella clipped the ball in from the right for Brazilian defender Doria to smash a close-range shot into the roof of the net and send Marseille into the last 16. Like us on Facebook
